articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: In neighbourhoods levelled by 15 months of war with Israel, Hamas officials are overseeing the clearance of rubble in the wake of Sunday's ceasefire. The group's gunmen are guarding aid convoys on Gaza's dusty roads, and its blue-uniformed police once again patrol city streets, sending a clear message: Hamas remains in charge.
articles.title: Hamas' tight grip on Gaza complicates plan for lasting peace

articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: The Trump administration is discussing a 10% punitive duty on Chinese imports. Trump said the EU also has troubling trade surpluses with the United States.
articles.title: Trump stirs tariff pot with fresh threats on EU, Feb 1 China deadline

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: He hails a fantastic woman sweeping all before her in Europe. She praises a strong and shrewd defender of the West. Donald Trump and Giorgia Meloni are fast forging a new transatlantic "special relationship".
articles.title: Trump whisperer? Italy's Meloni navigates a high-stakes relationship

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey has detained nine people, including the owner of the hotel, in connection with a deadly fire that claimed the lives of 76 people and injured dozens at a ski resort in western Turkey, Interior Minister Ali Yerlikaya said early Wednesday.
articles.title: Turkey detains nine people over ski resort hotel fire that killed 76

articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Michael Martina, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: Trump faces a challenge: US foes have become more unified following Russia's invasion of Ukraine
articles.title: Aiming to weaken US foes, Trump faces an 'unholy alliance'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prince Harry has settled his lawsuit against Rupert Murdoch's News Group Newspapers (NGN) over alleged unlawful information gathering, his lawyer said on Wednesday, after the start of a long-awaited trial was unexpectedly delayed.
articles.title: Prince Harry settles lawsuit with Murdoch papers after apology

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dawoud Abu Alkas, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: On foot or riding rickshaws, many Palestinians exhausted by war in Gaza began returning to the ruins of their homes on the third day of a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, shocked by complete destruction.
articles.title: Gazans' joy at ceasefire dims as they visit ruined homes and dig for the dead

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Five candidates' names will appear on the ballot for a presidential election in Belarus on Sunday, but for the past 31 years there has only been one winner.
articles.title: Lukashenko seeks easing of Belarus isolation as he extends his long rule

articles.author: Cecile Mantovani, Alexander Smith
articles.description: Panama's President Jose Raul Mulino responded "be serious, be serious" on Wednesday when asked in Davos whether he was concerned the U.S. would invade after President Donald Trump said he would take back the Panama Canal.
articles.title: 'Be serious', says Panama president on Trump 'invasion' question

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: South Korea's transport ministry said on Wednesday that it would remove the concrete embankment installed at Muan International Airport following last month's Jeju Air crash, its deadliest domestic air disaster.
articles.title: South Korea to remove concrete embankment blamed for exacerbating deadly plane crash
